title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
Hello,
I'm trying to fix a motherboard who doesn't turn on from an 2015 macbook pro 13"" 820-4924-A.
No trace of corrosion at all.
When I plug the charger, the magsafe light start from orange for half a sec then turn green then turn to Orange.
I did SMC Bypass: the light on the magsafe start orange and turn green when I release the power button. It turn back orange when I press again power.
Nothing on the screen, no fan spinning.
I'm using an 60w apple official charger.

I took some measurement :

[B]PPBUS_G3H [/B]: [B]12.55V
PP5V_S5 [/B]: [B]4.99V
pp3v42_G3H [/B]: [B]3.42V
PP3V3_S4 [/B]: [B]0v
PP5V_S4 [/B]: [B]0V
PP3V3_s0 [/B]- [B]0.08V[/B]

I've been looking for [B]PM_SLP_XXX [/B]:

[B]PM_SLP_S0_L [/B]: [B]3.33V
PM_SLP_S3_L [/B]: [B]Pulse few ms once when the charger is plugged in then go to 0v
PM_SLP_S4_L [/B]: [B]Pulse few ms once when the charger is plugged in then go to 0v
PM_SLP_S5_L [/B]: [B]Pulse few ms once when the charger is plugged in then go to 0v
PM_SLP_SUS_L [/B]: [B]3.33V[/B]

[URL='https://www.it-tech.com.au/mac-q-a/pm-slp-s4-l-timing/']I look on internet[/URL] and see that I need 11+1 prerequisites to turn on PM_SLP_S5_L, PM_SLP_S4_L and PM_SLP_S3_L to enable S4, S3 and S0 state power rails.

1. [B]PPVRTC_G3H [/B]: [B]3.33v[/B]
2. [B]RTC_RESET_L [/B]: [B]3.26v[/B]
3. [B]PCH_SRTCRST_L [/B]: [B]3.26v[/B]
4. [B]PCH_INTVRMEN[/B](?_L?) : [B]2.51v[/B]
5. [B]PCH_DSWVRMEN[/B](?_L?) : [B]2.51v[/B]
6. [B]SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTCX1  [/B]- Can't measure it because I don't have oscilloscope
7. [B]PP3V3_S5 [/B]: [B]3.33v[/B]
8. [B]PM_DSW_PWRGD [/B]: [B]3.42v[/B]
9. [B]PP3V3_SUS [/B]: [B]3.33V[/B]
10. [B]PM_BATLOW_L [/B]: [B]3.30v[/B]
11. [B]PM_RSMRST_L [/B]: [B]3.03v[/B]
+1. [B]PM_PWRBTN_L [/B]: [B]3.41V and stable[/B]

From what I understand from [URL='https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/820-3437-no-pm_slp_s4_l.61141/']this post[/URL], PCH_INTVRMEN is coming directly from the PCH so it's :
- the PCH who is bad
- connection from the PCH to the PCB who is bad
- "series resistances"
Is that correct and if yes, which "series resistances" is it ?

Additional measurement :
[B]pch_intruder_l [/B]: [B]1.67v [/B](seem bad too)

Best regards

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

"From what I understand from [URL='https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/820-3437-no-pm_slp_s4_l.61141/']this post[/URL], PCH_INTVRMEN is coming directly from the PCH so it's"
Wrong understood; that is a PCH input.

"pch_intruder_l : 1.67v"
Is the only bad reading; it is also PCH input.
And PCH will not start power on sequence untill get the correct level.
Force it with 100K instead of 1M in place of R1301.

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
Hello 2informaticos and thanks for the answer :).
Thanks for the correction.
I put a 100k resistor instead of the 1M in place as R1301 and have now PCH_INTRUDER_L at 3.29V.
Unfortunately, still no sign of life.

Assuming this : [URL]https://logi.wiki/index.php/G3_to_S3_State_for_Ivy_Bridge_Haswell_and_Broadwell[/URL]
PM_RSMRST_L : 3.03v being a good value, I understand that I can have a clock issue

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
When I trigger SMC_ONOFF_L, PM_PWRBTN_L drop at 0.32V and come back to 3.42 after release.
Sometime, PM_PWRBTN_L Stay at 0.32V until I cut the power.

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
Other information :
When plug in the charger in
[B]PP3V3_S4 [/B]pulse at [B]0.6V [/B]then go to 0V
[B]PP3V3_S0 [/B]pulse at [B]0.7V[/B](sometime 2.41V) then go to 0.07V
[B]PP3V3_S3 [/B]pulse at [B]0.7V [/B]then go to 0.07V

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
You should note the pulse at PM_SLP_Sx_L signals at same time with drop pulse on PM_PWRBTN_L.
Be sure PM_RSMRST_L is always/steady high.

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
Values when charger is plugged :
[B]PM_RSMRST_L [/B]is at [B]3.03V [/B]and is stable
[B]PM_PWRBTN_L [/B]:  [B]3.42v
PM_SLP_S5_L [/B]is at [B]0v
PM_SLP_S4_L [/B]is at [B]0v
PM_SLP_S3_L [/B]is at [B]0v
PM_SLP_S0_L [/B]is at [B]3.34v[/B]

When I trigger [B]SMC_ONOFF_L [/B]:
[B]PM_RSMRST_L [/B]is at [B]3.03V and is stable
PM_SLP_S5_L [/B]pulse to [B]1.5v [/B]then go back to 0v
[B]PM_SLP_S4_L [/B]pulse to [B]1.41v [/B]then go back to 0v
[B]PM_SLP_S3_L [/B]pulse to [B]1.31v [/B]then go back to 0v
[B]PM_SLP_S0_L [/B]is at [B]3.34v and is stable
PM_PWRBTN_L [/B]drop at [B]0.32V [/B]and go back to [B]3.42v[/B]

I Just realized that using my multimeter to check pulse could be not enough fast to catch accurate pulse value in this scenario. Unfortunately I don't have other measurement tools at my disposition ...

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
If you trigger SMC_ONOFF_L repedeatlly, may catch higher value.
However, 1.5V pulse can't be catched if respective signal doesn't pulse; good enough as confirmation.
You should check for pulse now on each power rail according with PM_SLP_Sx_L used as enable.

Try first to start in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
I tried to start in SMC_bypass mode, but my fan will not speed at all (should turn at full speed from what I understood) and 0V on PM_SLP_SX_L.

These are the highest values I caught by trigger [B]SMC_ONOFF_L [/B]repedeatlly :
[B]ALL_SYS_PWRGD[/B] pulse at [B]2v
DDRREG_EN[/B] : pulse at [B]2.37v
PM_SLP_S4_BTMUX_[/B]L : pulse at [B]2.43v
PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L[/B] : pulse at [B]1.41v
P1V05S0_EN[/B] : pulse at [B]1.53v
P1V8S3_EN[/B] : pulse at [B]2.34v 
P3V3S0_EN[/B] : pulse at [B]1.52v 
P3V3S3_EN[/B] : pulse at [B]2.34v 
P5VS0_EN[/B] : pulse at [B]2.31v 
P5VS3_EN_RC[/B] : pulse at [B]1.08v
PP1V05_S0[/B] : pulse at [B]0.7v 
PP1V5_S0[/B] : pulse at [B]1.04v 
PP1V2_S3[/B] : pulse at [B]0.6v
PP1V8_S3[/B] : pulse at [B]1.35v
PP3V3_S0 [/B]: pulse at [B]2.3v [/B]then go to [B]0.07v  stable[/B].
[B]PP3V3_S3 [/B]: pulse at [B]2.01v [/B]then go to [B]0.07v stable[/B].
[B]PP5V_S0 [/B]:  pulse at [B]3.72v
PP5V_S3 [/B]: pulse at [B]5v
S4_PWR_EN [/B]: pulse at [B]2.35v
S5_PWR_EN [/B]: [B]3.42V stable
USB_PWR_EN [/B]: pulse at [B]1.23v[/B]

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
Check for pulse at pins 7 & 3 of U1950.
Be sure no corrosion present on its area.

Any pulse at L7630 and L7310/20?

You can also test the board removing Q8150.

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
[B]U1950[/B] [B]:[/B]
no visible corrosion
[B]Pin 7[/B] : pulse at[B] 2.40v
Pin 3[/B] : pulse at [B]1.10v

L7630 :
Pin 1[/B] (P1V05S0_LL) : pulse at [B]1.2v
Pin 2[/B]  (PP1V05S0_REG_R) : no pulse

[B]L7310 :
Pin 1[/B] : no pulse
[B]Pin 2[/B] no pulse

[B]L7320 :
Pin 1[/B] : no pulse
[B]Pin 2[/B] no pulse

I removed Q8150 but I can't notice any change on the measurement

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
As per schematic, L7310/20 are tied together (on output pin); no need to measure both of them.
Also keep in mind, DC voltage must be checked on output pin; no reason to check both pins of a coil.

Really strange to get pulse on pin 3/U1950 but not on L7310/20 (VCORE).
Use quality flux and heat PCH die area.
No more than 200 degrees, for 15-20s; no need to melt the balls, just burn eventually accumulated crap.
PCH_INTRUDER_L issue denotes a problem on that area.

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
Thanks for the tips.
Unfortunately, I didn't change anything :(.

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
Tie together pins 5/6 of U1950 and test again the board.
Also check for pulse at PLT_RESET_L.

Can you note pulse on all output voltages from page 63?
Check them for short to ground.

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
I made mistake and my ground probe touched some part of the motherboard and burnt something.
I don't know what exactly burnt, but the short came from that location just like the smell. 
Couldn't find anything burnt with my eyes.
[ATTACH alt="mb.jpg"]60598[/ATTACH]

The logic board is doing pulse by itself every 4 sec.
I can hear a little tick coming from [B]Q7180[/B], [B]Y1915[/B], [B]Y1905[/B], [B]Y5110[/B]
I have no more drop pulse on [B]PM_PWRBTN_L [/B]when I trigger [B]SMC_ONOFF_L 
SMC_ONOFF_L [/B]doesn't make any measurements I took before pulse anymore but still affect the led of the magsafe when maintain close when the charger is plugged, the led doesn't change of color.

[B]PM_SLP_S0_L [/B]: 0.07V and pulse at[B] [/B]2.3v ([U]was at 3.33v stable before[/U]) 
[B]PCH_PM_SLP_S0_L[/B] : 3.33v stable
[B]PP3V3_S0 :[/B] 0.07v pulse at[B] [/B]2.3v 
[B]PM_SLP_SUS_L [/B]: 3.33V
[B]SMC_PM_G2_EN [/B]: 3.33v

[B]ppvrtc [/B]:[B] [/B]3.33 stable
[B]rtc_reset_l [/B]:[B] [/B]3.26 stable
[B]PCH_srtcrst_l [/B]:[B] [/B]3.26v stable
[B]PCH_intvrmen [/B]:[B] [/B]2.51v stable
[B]PCH_DSWVRMEN [/B]:[B] [/B]2.51v
[B]PP3V3_S5 [/B]:[B] [/B]3.33v
[B]PM_DSW_PWRGD [/B]:[B] [/B]3.42v
[B]PP3V3_SUS [/B]:[B] [/B]3.33v
[B]PM_BATLOW_L [/B]: 3.30v
[B]PM_RSMRST_L [/B]: 3.03v
[B]PM_PWRBTN_L [/B]: 3.41v and stable
[B]pch_intruder_l [/B]: 3.0v

[B]PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK [/B]: 0v pulse at 1.50v

[B]PM_SLP_S0_L[/B], from what I understand, it's coming from [B]U1420[/B].
[B]PCH_PM_SLP_S0_L [/B]go to pin 1-2 of [B]U1420[/B].
[B]U1420 [/B]is powered by [B]PP3V3_S0_PCH_GPIO[/B]
and should output [B]PM_SLP_S0_L[/B]

o_O

title: 820-4924-A - Doesn't turn on - Magsafe Orange
message:
I don't understand anything from that picture.
I can't see any location marked there.

Don't bother with PM_SLP_S0_L.
In fact, I don't understand how did you get 3V there (first post), if this signal is pulled up to 3V3_S0.
As per schematic, U1420 avoid high level on this signal, if machine isn't in S0 state.
